--- title: Brachioradialis --- ![Left Humerus (Anterior view) @grayAnatomyHumanBody1918](/The Archive/Images/Gray anatomy 1918 images/Osteology/image207 gray1918 Left humerus. Anterior view.gif){#fig-gray1918-image207} ![Muscles that move the Forearm @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.25 Muscles That Move the Forearm.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.25} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Wrist Extensor and Brachioradialis Muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 - MMT @weinstockNeuroKineticTherapyInnovative2010 ::: ::: {#tbl-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Brachioradialis Lateral distal humerus
Lateral intermuscular septum		 Styloid process of Radius Radial n.
C5 - C6		 Elbow: Flexion, Semipronation (to 90°)
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} - Lateral Humerus (*Superior to lateral supracondylar ridge*) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - Lateral intermuscular septum @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Insertion {#insertion} Styloid process of the Radius @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Innervation {#innervation} [Radial N.]({{< var ref-radial-nerve.path >}}) ([C5]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c5 >}}), [C6]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c6 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Elbow**: Flexion @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 - **Forearm**: Initiates pronation and supination @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 ![Brachioradialis acting as a synergist for the Biceps Brachii @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.2 Prime Movers and Synergists.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.2} # Notes # Reflex {#reflex} Brachioradialis reflex can be used to assess the C6 nerve root @hongReliabilityDiagnosticAccuracy2022.
